Subject: Re: [junit] Unit testing Exception classes
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=12653864; y=xkoQwF3ka6cotGg49wASrzyColbNc66gENKKWvsKCufcSNPH

J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

>   if (cause == this) throw new IllegalArgumentException("Exception 
> cannot be its own cause");
> 
> Since I almost never assign exception objects to variables -- but rather 
> type "throw new MyException(message, cause);", who writes code that 
> could possibly try to assign an exception as its own cause? Where have 
> you been working?! :)


This is the documented and required behavior of all Throwable objects in 
Java 1.4 and later. I'm just trying to duplicate that in Java 1.3 and 
earlier.If you consult the source code for java.lang.Throwable you'll 
see something similar. I told you this was tricky. :-)

By the way one place where exception objects do get assigned to 
variables is in a SAX parser, where an exception would need to be passed 
to an ErrorHandler, which then has the choice of whether to throw the 
exception or not.

--
